a member of the Coptic Church, the ancient Christian Church of Egypt, now based in Egypt and Ethiopia: Copts form the largest Christian community in Egypt and the Middle East. Copts follow an ancient type of Christianity.
an Egyptian during the ancient Greek and Roman periods: The Copts in Egypt wrote their language in Greek letters. Falafel are a staple of Egyptian food, thought by some to date back to the Egyptian Copts. Related word
Coptic
More examplesFewer examplesEthiopia's Copts celebrate their Christmas on 7 January. Copts, who derive their name from the Greek word "Aigyptios" for Egyptian, trace their roots to St Mark, who brought Christianity to Egypt after Christ's death.
